{"step_by_step_thinking": "LSCS stands for Lower Segment Cesarean Section, a type of cesarean section. An absolute indication for LSCS means a situation where this procedure is absolutely necessary. Co-arctation of Aorta, Ebsteins anomaly, and Pulmonary stenosis are heart conditions, but they are not absolute indications for LSCS. However, Eisenmenger syndrome is a severe form of pulmonary hypertension. It is a high-risk condition for pregnancy and is often considered an absolute contraindication for pregnancy. Therefore, if a pregnant woman has Eisenmenger syndrome, LSCS would be indicated to reduce the risk of complications.", "answer_choice": "B. Eisenmenger syndrome"}
